definition: to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: Atlas: I have woken the torment of the underworld, vanished to the darkest pit of Hades .
sentences.chinese: 我唤醒了地狱中的痛苦，在冥王最黑暗的深渊中隐去。

sentences.english: Godiwalla graciously changed all of the names of the characters in her book.
sentences.chinese: 高笛瓦勒在书中隐去了所有人物的真实姓名。

sentences.english: By the middy, clouds came out and the sun hid.
sentences.chinese: 到了中午，阳光隐去，乌云呈现。

definition: to vanish gradually/to disappear/to fade out
to cover/to mask/to cover up or conceal (the truth etc)
to cover/to hide from view/to obstruct or block/defilade (military)
to appear/to come out in the open
to show one's true nature (derog.)/to betray oneself
